meanings.sent1: She was able to clinch the deal with her persuasive arguments.
meanings.sent2: He clinched the victory with a powerful move in the final round.
meanings.sent3: The detective was able to clinch the case with a crucial piece of evidence.
meanings.sent4: Her smile clinched the decision in her favor.
meanings.sent5: The last-minute goal clinched the championship for the team.

meanings.sent1: He used a hammer to clinch the loose nail into place.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter needed to clinch the boards together to build the frame.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to clinch the lid tightly to prevent any spills.
meanings.sent4: She carefully clinched the necklace around her neck.
meanings.sent5: The lock on the door was clinched shut to ensure security.

meanings.definition: A final argument or agreement that settles a matter
meanings.sent1: The clinch of the debate left no room for further discussion.
meanings.sent2: The lawyers reached a clinch that resolved the legal dispute.
meanings.sent3: The siblings had a clinch about who would get the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The clinch between the two nations brought peace to the region.
meanings.sent5: The clinch between the parties ended the negotiations successfully.
